content:
Apologies for the confusion. Here's the revised itinerary with additional recommended places to visit on each day:

Day 1:
• Pickup from hotel 9:00 am
• Doi Inthanon (rank: 4.6)
• Wachirathan Waterfall (rank: 4.3)
• Trekking to visit waterfall and Karen village and some viewpoints (rank: N/A)
• Lunch at a local Karen restaurant (rank: N/A)
• King and Queen Pagoda (rank: 4.6)
• Hmong market (rank: N/A)
• Back to Chiang Mai around 6:00 pm

Note: On the way to Doi Inthanon, you can stop by the Royal Project Foundation (rank: 4.4) to see the agricultural research center, and on the way back from Doi Inthanon, you can visit Baan Tawai (rank: 4.5) to see the traditional Thai handicrafts.

Day 2:
• Pickup from hotel 9:00 am
• Mae Vang Elephant Sanctuary (rank: N/A)
• Lunch at a local restaurant (rank: N/A)
• Bamboo rafting in Mae Vang river (rank: N/A)
• Wat Ban Den (rank: 4.6)
• Back to Chiang Mai

Note: On the way to the elephant sanctuary, you can visit the Mokfa waterfall (rank: N/A) and the Mokfa elephant sanctuary (rank: N/A).

Day 3:
• Pickup from hotel 9:00 am
• Wat Chedi Luang (rank: 4.6)
• Bai Orchid Butterfly Farm (rank: 4.3)
• Bua Tong Sticky Waterfall (rank: 4.7)
• Air Diamond Cafe & Hotel (rank: N/A)
• Back to Chiang Mai

Note: On the way to the Bua Tong Sticky Waterfall, you can visit the Queen Sirikit Botanic Garden (rank: 4.4).

Day 4:
• Pickup from hotel 9:00 am
• Huay Tung Tao Sculpture Park (rank: N/A)
• Pong Yang Jungle Coaster @ Zipline (rank: N/A)
• Lunch at a local restaurant (rank: N/A)
• Mae Sa Elephant Sanctuary (rank: N/A)
• Back to Chiang Mai

Note: On the way to Huay Tung Tao Sculpture Park, you can visit the Mae Sa Waterfall (rank: 4.2) and the Mae Sa Snake Farm (rank: 4.1).
